intro: Kyrstenia ciliata, commonly known as the fringed kyrstenia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Kyrstenia ciliata thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine environments. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
